caption: Fig. 1. Metabolic pathway used by methanotrophic bacteria for methane oxidation.
Fig. 2. Descriptive scheme of the MBR developed.

Fig. 3. (a) Methanol production kinetics in a batch reactor for different biocatalyst concentrations (11 and 70 u ml1) and different volume ratios Vgas/Vliq (9 and 0.6); (b)
zoom on the methanol production kinetics; (c) associated productivities calculated on the basis of the methanol concentration obtained at 3 h and maximum methanol
concentrations accumulated in the batch reactors. Productivities are given in mg MeOH Mu1 h1 where u is the catalytic unit deﬁned in this work and 1 Mu = 106 u;
maximum methanol concentrations are given in mg L1.
Fig. 4. Methanol production kinetics within the MBR (biocatalyst concentration: 11 ± 1 u ml1 and Vgas/Vliq = 0.6).

Fig. 5. (a) Methanol production kinetics within the new MBR for different biocatalyst concentrations: 11 ± 1, 60 ± 4, 70 ± 5 and 150 ± 11 u ml1 over the maximum
production period and (b) associated productivities measured at 3 h.

Fig. 6. Evolution of methanol concentration ([MeOH]) and dissolved oxygen concentration ([Dissolved O2]) versus time in the MBR for a biocatalyst concentration of
70 ± 5 u ml1.
